sentences.en: Criticising all with hardly more reverence than the indian would feel for the clerical band the judicial robe the pillory the gallows the fireside or the church.
sentences.cn: 她几乎和印第安人一样，以不屑的态度批评牧师的丝带、法官的黑袍、颈手枷、绞刑架、家庭或教会。

sentences.en: For serious offences, use is made of the pillory as well as of the cangue, which latter is a heavy square wooden board round the neck.
sentences.cn: 对严重违法者，既使用颈枷也使用手铐。 颈枷是戴在脖子上的一块沉重的方木块。

sentences.en: She is pillory in the press for her extravagant parties.
sentences.cn: 她的聚会十分铺张,新闻界对她大加揶揄.

sentences.en: The education secretary was pilloried by the press for his latest proposals.
sentences.cn: 教育部长因其最近的提案而受到新闻界批评。

sentences.en: The world mocks at it and sometimes puts one in the pillory for it.
sentences.cn: 世人对它大加嘲笑,有时甚至由于它还把人送上颈手枷.

trans.tran_en: a wooden frame with holes for someone’s head and hands to be locked into, used in the past as a way of publicly punishing someone

trans.tran_cn: 给…上颈手枷；使…惹人嘲笑
使受公众嘲笑，将…示众，<史>给…上颈手枷，处…以枷刑
